result.execSummary:
The defendant Marchello A Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees including all mandatory surcharges.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with current sentence.  **07/14/14 Judge Dallet/amended**

superMiscConds.notes:
No further violations of the law.
No contact with victim at any time during the entire sentence unless approved by agent.
No  contact with his son unless the order is modified by the agent.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Interentin program.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant of:  penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction, he may never posses firearms or ammunition; also advised that as a convicted felon he must provide DNA sample, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marchello A Thomas in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Defendant Marchello A Thomas in custody.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements made by Trudy T. Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with current sentence, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 145 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 2 YEARS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim at any time during the entire sentence unless approved by agent.
- No contact with his son unless the order is modified by the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees. including all mandatory surcharges.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Andrea B. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26197808 in court 1x on 5/21/14.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 5/21/14 for Andrea B. for 1 appearance on 5/21/14.

Defendant Marchello A Thomas in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas K Hackbart in court, defendant Marchello A Thomas not in court, in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Marchello A Thomas in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Defendant Marchello A Thomas in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 5/21/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Marchello A Thomas in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Defendant Marchello A Thomas in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 5/21/14 in Branch 40.  State may be filing an Amended Information.  Court ordered matter adjourned for another final pretrial conference.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas K Hackbart in court, defendant Marchello A Thomas not in court, in custody.  Ryan T Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held off the record.  Case remains set for jury trial on 05/21/2014 in Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas K Hackbart in court, defendant Marchello A Thomas not in court, in custody.  Ryan T Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held off the record.  Case remains set for jury trial on 05/21/2014 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court, defendant Marchello A Thomas not in court, in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing  MARCH 5, 2014 received and filed. (17 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to   tHAMAS hACKBART - spd aPPOINTMENT  1333 cOLLEGE aVENUE  sOUTH mILWAUKEE, wi  53172.

Defendant Marchello A Thomas in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Marchello A Thomas in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk:  rmm.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF706 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:  Village of Greendale Detective Robert Windler.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Andrea B or M.T.

Defendant Marchello A Thomas in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Marchello A Thomas in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
